title: John Shirley (footballer)
text:
John Henry Shirley (1902–1968) was a <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Stoke%20City%20F.C.">Stoke City</a>.
Career.
Shirley was born in <a href="Crewe">Crewe</a> and began his career with non-league <a href="Whitchurch%20F.C.">Whitchurch</a> before joining <a href="the%20Football%20League">league</a> <a href="Stoke%20City%20F.C.">Stoke City</a> in 1927. He made a fine start scoring twice on his debut against <a href="Fulham%20F.C.">Fulham</a> in November 1927. However, despite that he never was considered to be a regular in the Stoke side by manager <a href="Tom%20Mather">Tom Mather</a> and he spent three seasons at the <a href="Victoria%20Ground">Victoria Ground</a> making 31 appearances scoring 11 goals. He went on to play for non-league sides <a href="Hednesford%20Town%20F.C.">Hednesford Town</a> and <a href="Macclesfield%20Town%20F.C.">Macclesfield Town</a>.
